intro: Dolicholus flavus, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of grass species. Dolicholus flavus is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
